comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- The Bain News Agency mistakenly dated the photo as December, 1914. It actually is part of the Bain photostream from December, 1913.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The elevated railway under construction in the photo put me in mind of another Bain/LOC image of street railway construction, that was posted on May 21, 2010:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4626426465/]

comment.author: 33913611@N07
comment._content: These are interesting to research and do, but they pretty much get no reaction here on Flicker:

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: JE Piper -- I think your matchups are nothing less than amazing. It must take hours to get each one just right.

comment.author: 33913611@N07
comment._content: Thank you, Wystan, from such a fine researcher as yourself.  Actually, when I see these photos I often recognize the buildings right away -- but I'm also working on some of the more challenging ones that have me stumped!

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan,

Thanks for catching that date mistake. Looks like the Bain folks were having trouble moving into the new year - or maybe trying to move more quickly into that new year, really.  We'll adjust the date in the record to Dec. 1913.

JE Piper,

That's a great comparison shot!  I have enjoyed looking at your set taken around NYC. What fun to see how things change - as well as how they stay the same!

comment.author: 54811531@N07
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/70251312@N00] 

Indeed, this is a picture of the same intersection taken from the opposite side.

comment.author: 37169126@N05
comment._content: Wystan's posting of the second picture is nice because it shows the same construction site from the opposite ends of the street - note the 'loft for rent' sign and Lincoln Trust Company building in both images.
